author: jwasinger
content:
hey I'm getting a new error when I try to fill tests after rebasing my branch of execution-spec-tests over latest `main`:

```
> ./venv/bin/fill tests/cancun/eip6780_selfdestruct/ --fork=Cancun --evm-bin=$(which evm)

  File "/Users/jwasinger/projects/execution-spec-tests/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/_pytest/assertion/rewrite.py", line 178, in exec_module
    exec(co, module.__dict__)
  File "/Users/jwasinger/projects/execution-spec-tests/src/ethereum_test_tools/common/types.py", line 28, in <module>
    from trie import HexaryTrie
ImportError: Error importing plugin "pytest_plugins.test_filler.test_filler": No module named 'trie'
```

author: techbro_ccoli
content:
A fresh install should hopefully do the trick:
```
source ./venv/bin/activate
pip install -e .[docs,lint,test] --force-reinstall
``` 
or even `pip install trie` but the former would be better

We added `trie` as a dependency very recently: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/commit/1d1a777cb265ae8cadc7b198eb9563f92aac7034#diff-fa602a8a75dc9dcc92261bac5f533c2a85e34fcceaff63b3a3a81d9acde2fc52R34
